messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI Job Iterator?
The ComfyUI Job Iterator implements iteration over sequences within a single workflow run in ComfyUI.
How do you install the ComfyUI Job Iterator?
To install the ComfyUI Job Iterator, you need to clone it into the custom_nodes directory. There are no dependencies.
What is the first step in using the ComfyUI Job Iterator?
The first step in using the ComfyUI Job Iterator is to make a SEQUENCE containing the values to use at each step.
How do you modify more than one parameter using the ComfyUI Job Iterator?
To modify more than one parameter using the ComfyUI Job Iterator, you need to make more SEQUENCES and turn them into JOBs.
What should you do after connecting to a JobIterator in ComfyUI?
After connecting to a JobIterator in ComfyUI, you should connect the attributes output to GetAttribute nodes to pull out the value of a name at the current step.
What is the next step after connecting the attributes output to GetAttribute nodes in ComfyUI?
After connecting the attributes output to GetAttribute nodes in ComfyUI, you should connect those values into a normal workflow.
What action triggers the execution of the job iteration process in ComfyUI?
Clicking 'queue prompt' triggers the execution of the job iteration process in ComfyUI.
What does the Stringify node in ComfyUI Job Iterator do?
The Stringify node in ComfyUI Job Iterator returns `str()` and `repr()` of the input.
What is the function of the Interact node in ComfyUI Job Iterator?
The Interact node in ComfyUI Job Iterator opens a debug REPL on the terminal where you ran ComfyUI whenever it is evaluated.
